chapter.pericope: Israel and Judah Will Be Delivered from Their Distress
chapter.p: 1The word that came to Jeremiah from Yahweh, saying,Literally “to say” 2“Thus says Yahweh, the God of Israel, saying,Literally “to say” ‘Write for yourself all the words that I have spoken to you in a scroll. 3For look, days are coming,’ declaresLiterally “a declaration of” Yahweh, ‘when I will restore the fortunesHebrew “fortune” of my people Israel and Judah,’ says Yahweh, ‘and I will bring them back to the land that I gave to their ancestorsOr “fathers” and they will take possession of it.’ ”
4Now these are the words that Yahweh spoke concerning Israel and concerning Judah. 5“For thus says Yahweh:

ul.li1: ‘We have heard a sound of trembling,
ul.li2: terror, and there is no peace.
ul.li1: 6Ask please and see whether a male can bear a child.
ul.li2: Why do I see every strong man
ul.li1: with his hands on his loins like a woman giving birth?
ul.li2: And why are all their faces changed to paleness?
ul.li1: 7Alas! For that day is great,
ul.li2: there is none like it.Literally “from none like it”
ul.li1: And it is a time of distress for Jacob,
ul.li2: yet from it he will be delivered.
ul.li1: 8And it will happen on that day,’ declaresLiterally “a declaration of” Yahweh of hosts,
ul.li2: ‘I will break his yoke from your neck
ul.li1: and your bonds I will tear to pieces.
ul.li2: And strangers will no longer let him work as a slave.
ul.li1: 9But they will serve Yahweh their God,
ul.li2: and David their king, whom I will raise up for them.
ul.li1: 10But you must not fear, my servant Jacob,’ declaresLiterally “a declaration of” Yahweh,
ul.li2: ‘and you must not be dismayed, Israel,
ul.li1: for look, I am going to save you from far,
ul.li2: and your offspring from the land of their captivity.
ul.li1: And Jacob will return,
ul.li2: and he will be at rest,
ul.li1: and he will be at ease,
ul.li2: and there will be no one who makes himHere the direct object is supplied from context in the English translation afraid.
ul.li1: 11For I am with you,’ declaresLiterally “a declaration of” Yahweh, ‘to save you.
ul.li2: For I will make a complete destruction
ul.li1: of all the nations to which I scattered you,
ul.li2: but you I will not make a complete destruction.
ul.li1: And I will chastise you to the measure,
ul.li2: and I will not leave you entirely unpunished.’

ul.li1: ‘Your injury is incurable,
ul.li2: your wound is overcome by sickness.
ul.li1: 13There is no one who pleads your cause,
ul.li2: for your boil there is no healing for you.
ul.li1: 14All your lovers have forgotten you,
ul.li2: they do not care for you.
ul.li1: I have struck you with the blow of an enemy,
ul.li2: the punishment of the cruel,
ul.li1: because of the greatness of your guilt,
ul.li2: your sins are numerous.
ul.li1: 15Why do you cry because of your wound?
ul.li2: Your pain is incurable.
ul.li1: Because of the greatness of your guilt—your sins are vast—
ul.li2: I have done these things to you.
ul.li1: 16ThereforeLiterally “To thus” all those who devour you will be devoured,
ul.li2: and all your foes, all of them will go into captivity,
ul.li1: and those who plunder you will be as plunder,
ul.li2: and all those who plunder you I will make as plunder.
ul.li1: 17For I will present healing to you,
ul.li2: and I will heal you of your wounds,’ declaresLiterally “a declaration of” Yahweh.
ul.li1: ‘Because they have called you an outcast, saying,
ul.li2: “It is Zion, there is no one who cares for her.” ’

ul.li1: ‘Look, I will restore the fortunesHebrew “fortune” of the tents of Jacob,
ul.li2: and I will have compassion on his dwellings,
ul.li1: and the city will be rebuilt upon its mound,
ul.li2: and the citadel fortress will stand on its rightful site.
ul.li1: 19And thanksgiving and the sound of merrymakers
ul.li2: will come out from them,
ul.li1: and I will make them numerous,
ul.li2: and they will not be few.
ul.li1: And I will make them honored,
ul.li2: and they will not be lowly.
ul.li1: 20And their children will be as of old,
ul.li2: and their community will be established before me.Literally “to the face of me”
ul.li1: And I will punish all their oppressors.
ul.li2: 21And their noble will be from them,
ul.li1: and their ruler will come out from their midst.
ul.li2: And I will bring him near and he will approach me.
ul.li1: For who is he that would pledge his heart to approach me?’ declaresLiterally “a declaration of” Yahweh.
22‘And you will be to me a people,
ul.li2: and I will be to you God.’ ”
ul.li1: 23Look, the storm of Yahweh!
ul.li2: Wrath has gone forth,
ul.li1: a whirling tempest.
ul.li2: It will whirl upon the head of the wicked.
ul.li1: 24The burning anger of YahwehLiterally “The blaze of the nose of Yahweh” will not turn back until his doing,
ul.li2: and until his accomplishing the plans of his mind.Literally “heart”
ul.li1: In the last of the days you will understand it.
